intro: Anna mollifolia, commonly known as the soft-leaved evergreen, is a species native to the coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are soft to the touch, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing small, fragrant white flowers. Anna mollifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
